key_points: Tiger Woods was involved in a single-vehicle crash on February 23, driving a Genesis GV80 SUV.
Los Angeles Sheriff's Department revealed Woods was traveling between 68 mph and 89 mph in a 45 mph zone at the time of the crash.
The crash occurred as Woods failed to negotiate a curve, resulting in the vehicle jumping the median and striking a tree.
The vehicle's Event Data Recorder showed speeds between 82 to 89 mph prior to median jump, and 99% accelerator pedal application with no brake applied.
Captain Jim Powers stated there was no evidence of Woods braking during the collision and speculated Woods mistakenly pressed the accelerator instead of the brake.
Woods was not cited or charged due to lack of an independent witness or officer to observe the speeding.
An Automobile investigation suggests Woods had to have been speeding prior to the events recorded on the black box given the vehicle's capabilities.
Powers remarked that Woods was not charged with reckless driving as there was no evidence of multiple violations or increased speed prior to the crash.
There was no evidence of intoxication or distracted driving found by the deputies.
Officials were unsure if the GV80's advanced driver assistance systems or onboard cameras were active or captured the crash.
